info.game_comments:
2001 Celebrity Jeopardy! game 5.
From the Las Vegas Hilton.

(1, 1).clue: The U.S. Navy bought the first modern one of these, which used gasoline on the surface & electricity below

(2, 1).clue: A Spanish–speaking host may say, "Mi casa es su casa", "My" this "is your" this

(3, 1).clue: This Dylan McDermott-Lara Flynn Boyle legal show "Made Perfect" as Best Drama in 1998 & '99

(5, 1).clue: This man says that the ball is about to drop in Times Square when you play his New Year's Rockin' Eve slots

(6, 1).clue: Smarter than the average bear, he stole picnic baskets from Jellystone Park

(1, 2).clue: Unlike 2000, 1900 wasn't one of these, so Thursday, March 1 followed Wednesday, Feb. 28

(2, 2).clue: It's the English meaning of the title of Wayne Newton's hit song "Danke Schoen"

(3, 2).clue: David Hyde Pierce has been nominated for an Emmy 7 times for playing this "Frasier" role, winning 3 times

(5, 2).clue: "Are you experienced" to play the slots that feature this legendary rock guitarist left-handed?

(6, 2).clue: Yoplait is a brand of this food

(1, 3).clue: One of these natural disasters killed 6,000 people on the Texas coast

(2, 3).clue: From Yiddish, it can mean liquid chicken fat or a sappy, sentimental story

(3, 3).clue: In 1993 Dan Castellaneta won an Emmy for voice-over for the "Mr. Plow" episode of this series

(5, 3).clue: The video slot seen here is based on this TV show

(6, 3).clue: Half Dome and El Capitan are features of this California national park

(1, 4).clue: Victor Emmanuel began a 46-year rule over this country, whose people thought his name was Vittorio Emanuele

(2, 4).clue: Dobre utra means "Good morning" in this language spoken in Omsk & Tomsk

(3, 4).clue: The Ken Burns series about this war won a 1991 Emmy for outstanding informational series

(5, 4).clue: Herman shouts "I'm rich, I'm rich" with every big win in the game based on this ghoulish TV family

(6, 4).clue: Looking at a skull, Hamlet says, "Alas, poor" this fellow of infinite jest

(1, 5).clue: Probably slapping & cursing, Walter Reed identified this insect as the cause of yellow fever

(2, 5).clue: If you meet a fine Finn in a bar, ask for this by saying, "Mika on puhelin numeronne"

(3, 5).clue: In 1989 Diane English won an Emmy for comedy writing for "Respect", the pilot episode of this series

(5, 5).clue: The Hard Rock Hotel & Casino has slots featuring this Sid Vicious–Johnny Rotten punk band

(6, 5).clue: Neil Simon wrote the play "Lost in" this city in New York

(1, 1).clue: Blind since birth, he's given us such great hits as "Part-Time Lover" & "You are the Sunshine of My Life"

(2, 1).clue: The memorable characters seen here were created by this man

(6, 1).clue: Seen here, this painting is probably the world's most famous

(1, 2).clue: With help from "miracle worker" Anne Sullivan, she learned to speak, & to read Braille, & even graduated college

(2, 2).clue: This late great entertainer's Vegas museum displays his dazzling costumes like the one seen here

(4, 2).clue: Pub beer stored in kegs or barrels & then drawn off is said to be "on" this

(6, 2).clue: The portrait of this artist's mother is really called "Arrangement in Gray and Black No. 1"

(1, 3).clue: For her film role in "Children of a Lesser God", she became the first deaf actress to win an Oscar

(2, 3).clue: People magazine's obit called this "Funny Face" actress "a rail-thin gamine during the zaftig zeitgeist"

(3, 3).clue: In this state, the 10 doesn't take that left at Albuquerque, but does hang a sharp right near Las Cruces

(4, 3).clue: It's the 2-word final warning to order drinks before the bar closes

(5, 3).clue: Much of this sitcom involved the goings on at WJM-TV in Minneapolis

(6, 3).clue: His "Rose Period" lasted from about 1904 to 1907 & included paintings of acrobats & circus performers

(1, 4).clue: Afflicted with cerebral palsy, Christy Brown not only painted with this appendage, he also wrote books & poetry

(2, 4).clue: This producer of "Grease" on film, "La Cage Aux Folles" on stage & the Oscars on TV died in 1999

(3, 4).clue: Entering this Texas city on the 10 East, hop onto the I-37 to visit the Alamo

(4, 4).clue: This balloon-shaped stemmed goblet that narrows at the top is used especially for brandy

(5, 4).clue: Premiering in 1979, it starred Robert Wagner & Stefanie Powers as husband-&-wife sleuths

(6, 4).clue: In the painting seen here, Édouard Manet showed himself and others in this city's Tuileries Gardens

(1, 5).clue: In 1999 he returned to the screen as an elderly ex-boxer in "Diamonds", his first film role since his stroke

(2, 5).clue: Last name of American astronaut Alan & his wife Louise, who died 5 weeks apart in 1998

(3, 5).clue: You could swing into this Florida city, the eastern end of the 10, for a Jaguars tailgate party

(4, 5).clue: Useful when making mixed drinks, it's a hinged device for lifting ice cubes

(5, 5).clue: Martin Miler & Kent McCored were on the beat as a couple of cops on this series

(6, 5).clue: Pretty pictures by this French painter include "Dancers in Pink", "Dancers in the Foyer" & "Four Dancers"

(0, 0).clue: First line of the poem thought to be based on Mary Sawyer's experience at a Massachusetts school-house around 1815
